alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 1:34PM MDT until July 16 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Cerro Pelado burn scar in... East Central Sandoval County in north central New Mexico... * Until 445 PM MDT. * At 134 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.75 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Vallecitos Creek, West Fork Borrego Canyon, Paliza Canyon, Canada Camada, Bland Canyon and Rio Chiquito. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Jemez Pueblo and Ponderosa. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Cerro Pelado fire burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
